label.name:
Cameroon Data
This rainfall data from Cameroon ...
label.intro:
Cameroon Data


This rainfall data from Cameroon has multiple sheets with one year of daily data on each sheet. We still have rows and columns, and the data are there, but the layout is of results sheets, rather than a shape to facilitate analyses. 

We have the days as the rows, and the different months are as columns. As a result, we have some blank values in our data: April, for example, has 30 days not 31. Therefore we do not have a meaningful value here.

There are also some summary values on each sheet.  

This is an example of a data frame that is not in rectangular format.


Recall that the Omani data included a sheet that was actually more of a pivot table. This example is like needing to reconstruct the Omani data sheets, if you only started with pivot tables.


How do we want this data to look?

  • We would entirely not want the bottom five rows: These are giving summaries and so do not belong in this format.
  • We would then also want to have three variables instead of 13: Day, Month, and Value.




We would then want to repeat this for all the data frames and add a Year variable.
